intro: Vitellaria catocladantha, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a species of tree native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its broad, elliptical leaves and yellowish flowers. The tree produces a valuable fruit that contains a nut used in the production of shea butter. It is often found in savanna and woodland habitats, thriving in areas with seasonal rainfall. Due to its economic importance, it plays a significant role in the livelihoods of many local communities.
